entry.def: Medical means relating to illness and injuries and to their treatment or prevention.

example.ex: Several police officers received medical treatment for cuts and bruises.
example.tran: 几名警官因割伤和擦伤而接受了医治。

entry.def: A medical is a thorough examination of your body by a doctor, for example before you start a new job.

means.word_mean: 1. a thorough physical examination; includes a variety of tests depending on the age and sex and health of the person

2. requiring or amenable to treatment by medicine especially as opposed to surgery;
3. of or belonging to Aesculapius or the healing art

sentences.cn: 进本公司前, 你得先做体格检查.
sentences.en: Before you join the company, you will have to have a medical examination.

sentences.cn: 在我们给你工作之前, 你得先做体格检查.

sentences.cn: 我开始上班之前要不要进行体格检查?

sentences.cn: 我得接受体格检查后才能开始做新的工作.

sentences.cn: 所有新生都将接受体格检查.
sentences.en: All the freshmen will undergo a medical examination.

sentences.cn: 每个人都必须通过一项必要的体格检查.
sentences.en: Each person have to pass an obligatory medical examination.

sentences.cn: 在体格检查中, 一些医师通过测量腰围来判断患者是否有增加此类疾病的风险.
sentences.en: During medical exams, some physicians measure circumference to identify patients at increased risk for these problems.

sentences.cn: 大夫或护士不在眼前,能够进行体格检查 吗 ?

sentences.cn: 这只是例行的体格检查, 没有什么可担心的.
sentences.en: It's just a routine medical examination, nothing to get worried about.
